page.title: 10ECOLOGY - SNOW
page.content:
Karen Ligertwood Age 9
In winter we get a lot of snow. Cars that travel past Drumochter Lodge where I live on the A9 get snowed in. At night the snow falls heavily. In the morning the road is covered in very deep snow. Sometimes we cannot get to school. Last year we had 300 people and a baby stranded. Every day my mum had to help my granny to feed them. They stayed in the Lodge. The snow did not stop until February. A helicopter came to our house with food. Drumochter was on T.V. The people stayed for a week. The snowplough and the police and rescue services came and got all the cars moving again. In the woods we found a snow buggy that had crashed into a tree.
